resource_dependency.databaseSchema: CREATE TABLE leads (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), email VARCHAR(255), phone VARCHAR(50), status VARCHAR(100), category VARCHAR(100), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP);

function: Fetch and display dynamic sales leads data from the backend API.
static_description: A table listing sales leads with columns for name, contact info, status, category, and timestamps. Background color set to papaya whip with dark orange borders around each cell.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a row opens a modal to view/edit lead details.
Infinite scroll loads more leads when reaching the bottom of the table.

function: Establish connection to PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables.
static_description: Backend server initializes a pool connection to PostgreSQL using pg library with configured credentials.

resource_dependency.sessionStore: Redis or in-memory store for session tokens

function: Authenticate users and manage their sessions securely.
static_description: Login form with username and password fields against a papaya whip background. Submit button styled with dark orange.

interaction_and_states.description: Submitting logs in user and redirects to dashboard upon successful authentication.

function: Provide an overview of sales leads with filtering and searching capabilities.
static_description: Dashboard page featuring a search bar, filter dropdowns, and a responsive grid/table layout showing lead summaries. Papaya whip background with dark orange accents on buttons and filters.

interaction_and_states.description: Filter dropdown toggles visibility of available filters; applying filters refreshes the lead list dynamically.
Typing in search bar debounces requests to update filtered results.

function: Allow creation, editing, categorization, and updating of lead statuses.
static_description: Modal form with input fields for name, email, phone, status dropdown, and category dropdown. Form has a save button styled with dark orange.

interaction_and_states.description: Save button submits changes via POST/PUT request to update or create lead entry.
Changing dropdown values updates internal state before submission.

function: Enable automated messaging to leads based on predefined templates and schedules.
static_description: Interface includes template editor, schedule configuration panel, and send now button. All components use papaya whip background with dark orange controls.

interaction_and_states.description: Send Now triggers immediate dispatch of selected message template to chosen leads.
Setting time/date activates cron job to trigger message delivery automatically.

resource_dependency.dropdownOptionsSchema: Table containing key-value pairs for dropdown options used across the app

function: Allow administrators to modify application-wide settings and dropdown choices.
static_description: Settings page with editable forms for configuring global parameters and managing dropdown lists. Styled with papaya whip background and dark orange form elements.

interaction_and_states.description: Save button persists updated settings to backend through PUT request.

function: Display visual analytics and performance metrics derived from sales data.
static_description: Reports section displays charts and tables summarizing KPIs such as conversion rates, lead sources, etc. Export button allows downloading reports as CSV/PDF.

interaction_and_states.description: Export button generates downloadable report file after fetching latest data.

function: Present curated content about CRM best practices and integration tips.
static_description: Advice section rendered as clean articles with papaya whip background and dark orange headings. Articles sourced from markdown files.

function: Apply consistent styling theme throughout UI using CSS variables.
static_description: Entire application uses CSS custom properties for background (papaya whip) and primary color (dark orange) applied globally.
